snippet: Israel has been consumed in recent months with the challenge of integrating the insular, swelling ultra-Orthodox minority, known as Haredim, into society.
abstract: Israel has been consumed in recent months with the challenge of integrating the insular, swelling ultra-Orthodox minority, known as Haredim, into society; only about 4 in 10 Orthodox men work, less than half the rate of other Jewish men in Israel, and nearly 60 percent of Heredi families live in poverty; unemployment has dire effect on economy in terms of productivity, taxes and welfare payments.

byline.contributor: Rina Castelnuovo and Myra Noveck contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Israel has been consumed in recent months with the challenge of integrating the insular, swelling ultra-Orthodox minority, known as Haredim, into society.

headline.seo: Israel’s Ultra-Orthodox Fight to Fit In
